Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but not so good location”
Reviews.Author: Jinthereddevil
Reviews.Content: For anyone who is confused by my comment 'not so good location' its not because of safety issues. The hotel is in a safe area but it's just so far away from civilization. If you suddenly want to go out somewhere at night like say a pub, restaurant, etc. you have to walk 5-10 minutes to the Schonefeld station to grab a train to your destination. The station is not 24 hours open so it could be a problem on weekdays. The hotel is rather nice though. Cosy rooms, friendly staff and good food in the restaurants. The pub, however, is not open everyday which can be a problem for some of you (like myself) recreational beer drinkers. The TV in the room is rather small and obsolete with very few channels to choose from featuring only German channels (showing American TV in German). So TV for non-Germans is not really a good option. The internet however is quite high speed. You can stream your TV shows or live TV online without any problem. All in all I would recommend this hotel for travelers wishing to stay in Berlin for not more than 3 days. More than that and you're bound to get a wee bit depressed for being away from civilization.

Reviews.Title: “Closeness to airport, very clean & nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Artur N
Reviews.Content: The Schoenefeld Airport is 10 minutes on foot. Very convenient when the departure is early in the morning. The restaurant works until midnight. The wireless internet connection works quite strangely. Usually, when buying Wi-Fi access (e.g. for 1 hour), I could log out when I did not need the internet anymore - in order to stop spending the time. Here I could not do so: the "Logout" button exists, but after pressing it nothing happens - and the paid time in the internet is wasted!

Reviews.Title: “Quirky Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Davsim3
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Albergo Hotel because we had a very early flight the next morning and didn't want to venture from the centre of Berlin. Being so close to the airport this hotel was a natural choice. On arrival the staff were very friendly and showed us to our room very quickly. The room was very well presented and I loved the heated flooring in the bathroom. After we had checked in we ventured down to the restaurant and I had one of the best pizza's I had ever eaten. Overall a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, good room”
Reviews.Author: JerryByrd
Reviews.Content: My flight was delayed arriving by a couple of hours until about 2:00 in the morning. When I called the hotel, there was a cheery voice and he came right over to SXF. The hotel is close, but too far to walk. Bed was sweet, room a bit hot. Opening the window gave me a chance to hear all the trains (quiet with window closed). No chance to check the food, an early departure and short night indicated a pass on breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “NICE LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: Mike A
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel,next to the airport and accesible to train and metro service for berlin and other german cities.

Reviews.Title: “unforgettable supper!”
Reviews.Author: Joszko
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, a little noisy (railway and road and the airport near by) but it is rather normal near to the airport:-) Anyway, the rooms have double glasses so it's not so bed. Free of charge shuttle service to the airport. They have an italian restaurant (Italian cook and waiters, this is important), we had a dinner and we were MORE THAN CONTENT!

Reviews.Title: “Great for an overnight stay----”
Reviews.Author: Chris W
Reviews.Content: It's within walking distance of the airport, on a main road, beside a railway line, surrounded by small business parks--which has it's benefits and problems. We had an early flight and needed to be near the airport. It's a 10 min walk or take advantage of the free lift--hassle-free. Breakfast is served from 0630hrs--very convenient. It has a very acceptable Italian restaurant on site which stays open late...no need to leave the hotel. Rooms are compact and clean.It's very good value and breakfast is almost cheap. Service is friendly and efficient-----it's all we wanted for an overnight stay. However, the location is a bit depressing at the end of a lovely weekend, rooms could be noisy if you want the windows open and it's souless.

Reviews.Title: “Near the airport”
Reviews.Author: xplosiv
Reviews.Content: I stayed alone in this hotel last August. Before flying out I did the usual of looking up hotels and reading the reviews but it's always difficult to make a decision! As I travel alone regularly I tend to go to hotels where there are fewer rooms as it makes me feel safer. This hotel is near the airport and I can see that it would definately suit business people as opposed to young travellers as it is probably too quiet. However the train station is only a 10 minute walk away. The room was clean and the staff were friendly....other than that the hotel was ok. There is an Italian restaurant attached to this hotel where the food was ok and the sevice was good. I tended to eat out in Berlin and come back and sit on the terrace to enjoy a few beers. This is a good hotel to stay in if you don't want to be in the hustle and bustle of the city or if you want to be close to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: rwhenrydvm
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights. Rooms are clean, bright and in 1800´s decor. The buffet breakfast very good. Attention by hotel staff to us was great. Location was less than one block from the U - uderground. At a price of $100 per night per double it was a great value. Try it. Bob

Reviews.Title: “Two-star at best; you can do much better than this one.”
Reviews.Author: bigmutt
Reviews.Content: We stayed a week so this is not based on just a few days. over-priced, far from everything, breakfast included but you better get there at 7 a.m. if you want some luke-warm eggs and sausages: they're gone by 8 and they don't replace most of the items that run out early, like croissants, a few pieces of fruit, etc. but there's cold-cuts and juice and cereal & yogurt & breads; great "home-made" wholegrain bread. Oh, and the coolest automatic coffee machine ever!! Has snotty morning/daytime receptionist but nice one late-afternoon and evenings; small noisy rooms, NO A/C !! bad mattresses, tiny shower but effective; no electric outlet in bathroom for hairdryer or shaver or whatever; no reading lights, tiny t.v. set, windows open just a crack so you'd better hope for cool weather if you're here in summer. But: free wireless LAN, free bathrobe, and LOTS of red, satiny drapes, pillows, bedcovers etc to simulate an Italian decorated hotel. Beautiful from the outside, well-worn on the inside. The general area is pleasant enough, but in the evening, no inexpensive restaurants nearby: only a snack grill (Doener sandwiches from Turkey, and hamburgers). There's a nice little supermarket 3 blocks away, though. And during the day (if you're hanging around your hotel instead of being out in the city doing tourist stuff) there are some small restaurants and bakeries, etc. in the area, and especially down in the U-Bahn below street-level. U-Bahn : to get to ANY of the "attractions" you'll need to transfer at least once, usually twice. If a small red canopy over your bed and heavy red curtains, etc. is REALLY important to you, you may like this place, but I'd say pass on this one; there's much better hotels in the 100-dollar per night range. Like I said, we spent a week, and it was no-where near as good a value as our week in Munich was. Far from it.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient hotel, no complaints”
Reviews.Author: Sabahanne
Reviews.Content: I booked into the Albergo Berlin because I was a woman alone arriving on a late flight to Berlin Shoenefeld airport. All you have to do is just walk out to the main street in front of the airport, walk to the left for about 5 minutes and you are there. I got a very good rate on booking.com. The desk staff were lovely and helpful, the room was immaculately clean, and the breakfast buffet was great, as were the dining room staff. The rail station is opposite the airport so It is very simple to travel into the centre of Berlin, either by train or metro. On the train, you can reach Alexanderplatz in about 20 minutes, about 10 minutes longer to Zoologischer Garten. The metro may be quicker if one is pressed for time, but the train is a very enjoyable ride - clean, comfortable and uncrowded.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty Albergo”
Reviews.Author: jokar13
Reviews.Content: A 4 star hotel with a 1 star attitude. The room was dirty, with dirty floors and very dusty at higher levels. I wrote my name in the dust on the television in room 403 and added the date, I wonder how long it will be there! It cost us 9.40 euro for 2 x 75cl bottles of water. Breakfast was poor ,one you coukld associate with a low starred hotel. The waiting staff and the cleaning staff were functional whilst a good point was the reception staff who were very helpful. On arrival we were allowed to put our cases in the room which was not ready. However, we had noticed that the pillow cases needed changing as they were stained. When we came back that evening the room was made up and it was not until the following morning that we realised the pillow cases were the stained ones. We were allocated 1 bath towel and 2 hand towels and on our request this was changed but we ended up with 2 bath towels and 1 hand towel. The toilet seat was cracked underneath and the fitting was loose, the shower leaked onto the floor as the shower door did not fit correctly.

Reviews.Title: “Good for one night!”
Reviews.Author: darkscot
Reviews.Content: If you know where this hotel is and don't have much luggage you can very easily walk to it from the airport. I didn't know how far it was and so took a taxi which cost 4euro and did not endear me to the driver. I arrived late (22:45) but the receptionist was friendly and helpful. The room was small, basically furnished and scruffy. It was also VERY hot which forced me to open the windows. After five minutes I found out how close it is to the S-Bahn line (VERY!). In spite of that i managed to sleep with the windows open even though there were trains all night. Breakfast was in a seperate building but only 30 seconds walk from reception. it was a typical German style buffet and very good indeed. Service was efficient and friendly. For the price and proximity to the airport I think this is excellent value for a one night stay. The only thing that let it down was the scruffiness of the rooms, they could do with re-decorating.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stopover”
Reviews.Author: ~~Dan`C_007
Reviews.Content: We only stayed at this hotel for one night and that was purely due to its proximity to the airport, our flight’s scheduled arrival time and the fact the rooms were cheap at the time of booking. However I would have been more than happy to have spent my entire stay here! The hotel was beautifully constructed in an authentic Mediterranean theme and felt very warm and cosy. Our room was tastefully decorated and in immaculate condition. Although we did not dine at this hotel or make use of the leisure facilities our sneaky peaks confirmed they were up the standard of the rest of hotel. The selection of information for tourists was perfectly ample and in fact it here we discovered the excellent walking tours of Berlin (newberlintours.com). The hotel’s location is excellent for airport access but sadly a 30-40 minute train ride to the city centre. My only complaint of the Albergo is the noise from the S-Bahn which runs all throughout the night. Overall a very comfortable hotel but too pricey, at full rate at least, given its awkward location and availability of other hotels in the city centre.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible hotel, but Close to Schonefeld airport”
Reviews.Author: tomber
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at this (nominally 4*) hotel because it was close to Schonefeld Airport. Well, it was close, but awful. Definitely not 4*, Rooms, are old, ugly and look dirty. Never received a paint in 10 years. Cost us 85 Euros

Reviews.Title: “Having a morning flight from Schönenfeldt- Stay at this one”
Reviews.Author: Leifaa
Reviews.Content: Not situatied in the most interesting part in Berlin, but if you want to avoid S-bahn early in the morning to go to the airport, this hotel can me very practical. Got a very discounted rate from the web (€55) and for a single room I think that is very good in a four star hotel. Staff were friendly and efficent and the sauna is nice. The hotel also has a free shuttle service to the airport. Just sign up for it the day before. Will stay here again if I am having a morning flight from Schönenfeldt.

HotelInfo.Name: Albergo Hotel Berlin
HotelInfo.Address: Wassmanndorfer Chaussee 2 | Schönefeld, 12529 Berlin, Germany
